summary: This is a federal indictment charging correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas with conspiracy and making false records related to their failure to conduct mandated inmate counts and rounds at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019. The indictment alleges their dereliction of duty allowed Jeffrey Epstein to commit suicide while unobserved in the Special Housing Unit.

persons.context: Indicted for conspiracy and falsifying records by failing to perform required inmate counts and rounds in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019, during which time Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Indicted alongside Noel for conspiracy and falsifying records related to the failure to conduct inmate counts and rounds in the SHU on the night of Epstein's suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by suicide in the SHU on August 10, 2019, while Noel and Thomas failed to perform their monitoring duties. He was detained on federal sex trafficking charges.

connections.description: Indicted together for conspiring to defraud the United States by falsifying count slips and failing to perform inmate monitoring duties at the MCC.
Noel was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU on the night of his suicide.
Thomas was one of the correctional officers responsible for monitoring Epstein in the SHU. He also responded to Epstein's prior apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Detention
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and detained at the MCC on federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: MCC officers, including Michael Thomas, found Epstein in his SHU cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck. He was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Failure to Perform Counts and Rounds Begins
events.description: Tova Noel and other officers failed to perform the 4 p.m. and 10 p.m. institutional counts in the SHU, falsifying the corresponding count slips.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his SHU cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. after Tova Noel and Michael Thomas failed to perform any counts or rounds from approximately 10:30 p.m. the previous night.

events.title: Discovery and Admission
events.description: Noel and Thomas discovered Epstein's body. They later admitted to a supervisor that they had not completed the 3 a.m. or 5 a.m. rounds, with Thomas stating 'we messed up'.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9th floor of MCC
keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are charged with conspiracy and making false records for failing to conduct mandated inmate counts and rounds in the MCC's Special Housing Unit on August 9-10, 2019.

No institutional counts or 30-minute rounds were conducted in the SHU from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9 to 6:30 a.m. on August 10, despite officers filing falsified paperwork for all five required counts.
Jeffrey Epstein was found dead by suicide in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, during this period of no monitoring.
The indictment details that instead of working, Noel and Thomas sat at their desk, browsed the internet, and appeared to sleep for a two-hour period.
Epstein had been placed in the SHU due to suicidality risk and was supposed to have a cellmate, but his cellmate was transferred out on the morning of August 9 with no replacement assigned.
